name: Build a wooden shelter
goal: Safe shelter using wood variants first, then falling back to other solid blocks
environment: Pick a flat spot away from lava and steep drops
Capture perceived nearby blocks to guide material choices

steps.title: Analyze Inventory for Wood
steps.details: Scan inventory specifically for item names containing 'log', 'planks', 'wood', 'stem', or 'stripped'. If found, set these as the primary 'material' parameter for the build step.
checks: Identified specific block name (e.g., 'oak_log') to use as material
If no wood is found, identify cobblestone or dirt as fallback

steps.title: Collect materials
steps.details: If inventory has < 24 solid blocks, gather wood first. Mine trees to get 'log' items. Only gather dirt/cobblestone if no trees are nearby.

steps.title: Clear Build Area
steps.details: Move to a position at least 3 blocks away from the intended build origin to prevent getting stuck inside the blocks.
checks: Bot is not standing at the build origin coordinates

steps.title: Lay out foundation
steps.details: Place a 3x3 or 4x4 platform. IMPORTANT: In the params, set 'material' to the EXACT name of the block found in inventory (e.g., 'oak_planks'), do not use generic 'wood'.
checks: Material parameter matches an item currently in inventory

steps.title: Raise walls and install roof
steps.details: Build walls 2 blocks high. Use the same material priority: Wood -> Cobblestone -> Dirt.
checks: Bot is outside the structure while building

steps.title: Secure entrance
steps.details: Place a door or trapdoor at the opening. If unavailable, use a solid block to seal it.

notes: When generating the 'build' command, the 'material' parameter MUST match a string in the inventory. 'wood' is not a valid block name; use 'oak_log', 'spruce_planks', etc.
